crypto.name: Cryptic Grid
crypto.desc: Cryptic Grid uses deep math to harvest your tears, but just solve the puzzle and claim your victory instead!

crypto.name: Cryptic Grid II
crypto.desc: New Cryptic Grid is running here, try to find the flag!

crypto.name: Flux key
crypto.desc: The Flux Key is in constant flux but analyze the system find the static weakness and decrypt the flag.

crypto.name: Kiss ASIS
crypto.desc: That new RSA boundary is just a suggestion, so analyze Kiss ASIS, exploit the weakness, and claim your flag.

crypto.name: Ralia
crypto.desc: Forge your legend, only Ralia separates math masters from the rest ;)

crypto.name: Seknipel
crypto.desc: Seknipel laughs at weak keys, its towering primes guard the flag ruthlessly ;)

hw.name: Bit Mosaic
hw.desc: An mosaic display was tapped mid‑story. All we have are some toggles and a promise that the picture is worth the trouble. Let's see what beauty was drawn.

hw.name: ESP Home
hw.desc: Help me to find my credentials in ESP Home!

misc.name: Honeymoon
misc.desc: During a honeymoon, everyone hopes for boundless time and infinite joy. Yet, it seems to fly by in a rush, doesn't it? Why is that?

misc.name: TeXyC
misc.desc: Analyze the weird TeXyC PDF file to uncover the secret message hidden within this challenge and capture the flag.

misc.name: Zone of Order
misc.desc: In the command region, known as the zone of order, all actions of every entity are logged and recorded. Examine the attached file in this zone and find the flag.

pwn.name: ASIS QShredder
pwn.desc: Are you using Virtualization every day? We have SuperSecure Shredder for your SECRETS.

pwn.name: BabyNotes
pwn.desc: Welcome to BabyNotes! Your notes, our responsibility ;)

pwn.name: KList
pwn.desc: Let's have a KList, shall we?

pwn.name: Kanglixia
pwn.desc: Conquering the Kanglixia pwn challenge requires grit; bypass those brutal stack protections, smash the binary, and claim your glory!

pwn.name: MIOT
pwn.desc: Can you recover my MIOT device?

pwn.name: Midagh
pwn.desc: Exploit the Midagh supposedly secure web server that simply adds two integers. Discover the bug to capture the hidden flag.

pwn.name: Singleton
pwn.desc: You shall not pass the Singleton!

rev.name: False BBC
rev.desc: BBC's false news agency allegedly transmitted a secret message using unusual binary encoding. Decode the message and wrap the final flag in ASIS{}.

rev.name: Feshaar
rev.desc: When the Feshaar pressure mounts, squeeze every bit from that stubborn binary until the hidden flag finally pops out!

rev.name: Gagool
rev.desc: Although Gagool asks for a number greater than infinity, just reverse the check and secure your glorious victory now.

rev.name: Lavish
rev.desc: That lavish encrypted secret message is just spicy math, so reverse the algorithm, decrypt it, and steal the flag!

rev.name: Nava
rev.desc: That nava visualization isn't modern art, so stop admiring it, reverse the pixels, and extract the secret flag now!

rev.name: Patona
rev.desc: The binary output from Patona has been made available to us, but we have not yet found a way to determine the input message that produced this file. Is it possible to reverse this binary?

rev.name: Present
rev.desc: No matter where you go, everyone is connected. What is written becomes something else before it runs in this present.

rev.name: Uberalt
rev.desc: Analyze the legacy Uberalt cryptosystem code, reverse engineer the algorithm, and exploit the hidden vulnerability to retrieve the flag.

web.name: ASIS Web Mail
web.desc: This is our secure military-grade ASIS Web Mail. Enjoy :)

web.name: Bookmarks
web.desc: I'm creating a bookmark site for my friends, do you like it? Feel free to test it out!

web.name: GemViewer
web.desc: Solving GemViewer web challenges is tough, but ultimately, everyone needs a GemViewer app to properly review their Gem files!

web.name: HgHub
web.desc: Mastering complex HgHub web challenges is thrilling, but ultimately, everyone needs a HgHub to truly unlock their full potential.

web.name: Ricks gallery
web.desc: Let's take a look at Rick's gallery.

web.name: W4 Schools
web.desc: I’m creating a new website to learn HTML. Sandboxing shouldn’t be too difficult, right?
